messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: NASA is now working to find and record some of the smaller asteroids, which are large rocks that travel through space. They are looking for those that are 140 metres wide or more. NASA thinks there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size, but so far they have only found about 8,000 of them, which means 17,000 have not been found yet. These middle-sized asteroids will be a serious danger if they come close to Earth, because a much smaller 19-metre asteroid injured 1,200 people when it exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia in 2013.
Feedback received: Grade 1/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: The submission is an instant FAIL. The primary reason is a violation of the Stage 1 CEFR Compliance Check. The target level was B1, but the output was classified as B2.

A B1 text is expected to have a mix of simple and compound sentences, whereas this submission consistently uses more complex structures (e.g., relative clauses with 'which' and 'that', subordinate clauses with 'when') with a high degree of accuracy, which is more characteristic of a B2 level.
